page.title: 09Tourism north: FINTRY
page.content:
Fintry supports the needs of{day, {weekend and longer stay}visitors and holiday makers.
{Culcreuch House (Castle) & its grounds open to the public in the summer and refreshments are available. One of its lodges and several{log cabins}sited in the woods, can be hired by the week.
The{Ross Caravan Site}caters for touring and permanently sited vans. There is a central club house with refreshment facilties. Some of the farms on the B822 Kippen road offer {bed & breakfast.
{The area is peaceful,}has many gentle walks and some more strenuous ones. The fishing is good and the area{well {sited for Loch Lomond, the Trossachs, {Glasgow, Stirling and Edinburgh.
